metadata.synopsis: Karlach at party organized by Withers.Variant:Avernus w/ Wyll & PlayerAvernus w/ WyllAvernus w/ PlayerMindflayer soloMindflayer romanced with avatar

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Oh shit. Oh my gods! He wasn't kidding. Withers, you mad bastard, you brought us back!
2.context: NodeContext: talking to her partner, not to withers directly

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: Commander Zhula won't know where the fuck we went. Ha!

127.speaker: Karlach
127.text: Man, I can't wait to say hi to everyone. Look at 'em, the beauts.

109.speaker: Karlach
109.text: Rest up, soldier. My tin can'll be all right for the night. And you and me will get to sleep with both eyes shut for the first time in... six months?

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: Then again, maybe we won't sleep at all.
17.context: NodeContext: Flriting with her partner. Times are tough in Avernus so it's been hard to have together time. But now that they're safe for the night...

357.speaker: Player
357.text: I like the sound of that.

292.speaker: Karlach
292.text: Me too, my love. See you soon.

303.speaker: Karlach
303.context: CinematicNodeContext: GEneric kissNodeContext: Sweetly, going in for a kiss

209.speaker: Karlach
209.context: CinematicNodeContext: GEneric kissNodeContext: Sweetly, going in for a kiss

13.speaker: Karlach
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: GEneric kissNodeContext: Sweetly, going in for a kiss

105.speaker: Karlach
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: GEneric kissNodeContext: Sweetly, going in for a kiss

295.speaker: Player
295.text: Wyll seems to be having a good time. We should enjoy ourselves, too, before your heart heats up and we need to head back.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: Looking forward to that. But first - a bit of fun.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Hear, hear. Enjoy it, soldier. You've earned it.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: Now that we can breathe a little, how about a hug?

376.speaker: Player
376.text: You sure your engine will be all right?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Wyll seems to be having a good time. We should enjoy ourselves, too, before your heart heats up and we need to head back.

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: She's got a night in her, I think. Any trouble and I'll toddle back off to hell, quick as you please.

273.speaker: Karlach
273.text: Oh hey! Before you go. I've been thinking about those blueprints we found.

339.speaker: Karlach
339.text: Zariel's probably got a load of cambions guarding that forge. I'm sure she knows I'll want in. She'll do anything to stop me from fixing this thing.

344.speaker: Karlach
344.text: I might have an in with one of the guards though. You may remember my old friend Flo. Not sure she'll help us, but... maybe.

201.speaker: Karlach
201.text: I might have an in with one of the guards though. An old acquaintance called Flo. Not sure she'll help us, but... maybe.

211.speaker: Karlach
211.text: We might get to come home - permanently. Maybe even sooner than we think.

353.speaker: Karlach
353.text: Sounds like you've been keeping busy.

217.speaker: Karlach
217.text: Sounds like you've been keeping busy. Glad you have someone at your side all the way.

235.speaker: Karlach
235.text: That can't have been easy. Glad you've stayed upright, anyway.

293.speaker: Karlach
293.text: That can't have been easy. Glad you've got backup.

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: It's good to see you again, soldier. I hope it won't be the last time.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Are you enjoying yourself, my love?

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I am. It's great to have the old team back together.

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: Fascinating, isn't it? Everyone has changed so much. Yet the heart of it all feels so familiar.

140.speaker: Karlach
140.text: I can't wait to say hello, but to be honest, I'm keen to visit the doctor before it gets too late.

265.speaker: Karlach
265.text: He said there's a potential in his infirmary. A very old woman recently diagnosed with a wasting sickness. She seemed interested in what I have to offer.

141.speaker: Karlach
141.text: I'll want to have a good long talk with her before we make an arrangement. Though if I'm being very selfish, I hope she'll say yes. I'm absolutely famished - and think of all those memories.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Glad to hear. I was worried you were getting hungry.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: I don't hide it well, do I? Some things don't change, even when everything else does.

187.speaker: Karlach
187.text: It's funny. I'm hungry in my body, but in my soul too. That woman has lived a long life - births, deaths, love, misfortune. And if she agrees, I'll be able to give her a dignified end, and remember it all in her honour.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: But hey, I'm getting ahead of myself. Let's enjoy ourselves! This is a rare enough treat, isn't it?

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I'm still not sure how I feel about this arrangement. Are you sure its ethical to feed on the dying?

102.speaker: Karlach
102.text: I'm sure of very little these days. But at least this way, I can live. And those who offer themselves to me can live on too.

315.speaker: Karlach
315.text: Births, first loves, marriages, losses - I remember them all and always will. Each memory I've consumed is of value.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: We'll make sure you're well-fed, my dear. And perhaps I'll pick up something warm on the way home, too.

173.speaker: Karlach
173.text: I'd ask what you have in mind, but I'm not sure I want to know.

307.speaker: Karlach
307.text: But let's focus on the task at hand. We've been brought here to enjoy ourselves and see some old faces. Let's not be rude.

319.speaker: Player
319.text: We'll make sure you're well-fed, my dear. And perhaps I'll pick up something warm on the way home, too.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: You're too deferential. My pet can have the brain of anyone she wishes.

250.speaker: Karlach
250.text: Gods. Sometimes I really question what we've both become.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: She will give you the answer you desire. The Dark Lady has given me the skills needed to compel her.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: We can stop at the infirmary on the way back to the cottage.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: I thought so too. The doctor will keep a light on, I'm sure. I just hope your parents won't wait up for us.

355.speaker: Player
355.text: I'm sure we can make time to stop by the infirmary - we're on nobody's schedule but our own.

282.speaker: Karlach
282.text: I thought so too. The doctor will keep a light on, I'm sure.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Then it shall be done. A duke's betrothed should want for nothing.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Then it shall be done. The Sword Coast needs you in tip-top shape, whether it knows it or not.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Then it shall be done before we return to Avernus. I need you at your very best.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Source of my Joy - we will visit the doctor and procure what you desire.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: You've only to ask, my love. We can stop in on the way home.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I don't want you to think the Urge is back, but I find you so beautiful when you feed.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Can I have a kiss before we rejoin the party?

369.speaker: Player
369.text: I'd rather go off to a quiet corner with you.

277.speaker: Karlach
277.text: Bold. There'll be plenty of time for that after we're caught up with our old friends.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: I can't believe these six months have passed so fast.

165.speaker: Karlach
165.text: And another will go by before we realise it. Make the most of Withers' little reunion. For all we know, it could be our last.

168.speaker: Karlach
168.text: Anyway, I'll need to visit the doctor on our way home.

128.speaker: Karlach
128.text: Look at this place. At us. This is the best party I've ever been to.

172.speaker: Karlach
172.text: Oh shit. Oh my gods! He wasn't kidding. Withers, you mad bastard, you brought me back!

352.speaker: Karlach
352.context: NodeContext: Spots the player. Sag of emotion - happy, but bitersweet

318.speaker: Karlach
318.text: But glad as I am to see you, I've got a bone to pick with you, Lae. A serious one.

259.speaker: Karlach
259.text: You left. You didn't think twice. You knew my heart was ready to go, and you couldn't wait.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: It's the one thing I wanted. To have you by my side when my time came. And you weren't there. Luckily, I have truly excellent friends.

161.speaker: Karlach
161.text: You did what you felt you had to do. But I needed you. I've never needed anyone more.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: You speak true. I was remiss to leave you. How can I ever make it up to you?

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: I've thought of a few ways. Some of 'em will take awhile. Years. So you've got to decide if you're up for that.

335.speaker: Karlach
335.text: You fucking better! Gods, imagine being at death's door and the person you love the most is flying off on a fucking dragon?!

164.speaker: Karlach
164.text: At least you looked legendary as hell while you were breaking my heart.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: My people's freedom comes first. I thought you understood that.

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: They could've waited a little longer. Maybe you don't think so. I mean, clearly you don't.

143.speaker: Karlach
143.text: I forgive you for that, though. I know the person you are. Dedicated. Loyal to your cause above all else. Including me.

271.speaker: Karlach
271.text: I've had six months to make my peace with that. And I really am happy as hell to see you.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I'm glad to see you too.

178.speaker: Karlach
178.text: Hang on. I need to get this out before we can even think about picking up where we left off.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: Let me apologise first. I left you too soon - I was focused on my people.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: I thought I was your people.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: I've missed you. Like, I've really missed you. And you're so... shimmery.
26.context: NodeContext: referring to a player who is here by hologram

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: I've missed you, man. Like, I've really missed you. And you're so... tentacly.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: I've missed you, man. Like, I've really missed you. And you're so... I don't know. Yourself.
61.context: NodeContext: Spots the player. Sag of emotion - happy, but bitersweet

110.speaker: Karlach
110.text: I've missed you, man. Like, I've really missed you. Against my better judgement, probably, but still.
110.context: NodeContext: Spots the player. Sag of emotion - happy, but bitersweet

245.speaker: Karlach
245.text: I've missed you, girl. Like, I've really missed you. I don't imagine you've missed me, you old Sharran, but... hey.
245.context: NodeContext: A little bit teasing, a little bit genuinely afraid SH hasn't missed her since she's turned to Shar

341.speaker: Karlach
341.text: I've missed you, girl. Like, I've really missed you. My old friend Shadowheart. Hang on, why do you smell like hay?
341.context: NodeContext: Spots the player. Sag of emotion - happy, but bitersweet

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: I've missed you, girl. Like, I've really missed you. My old friend Shadowheart.
98.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, almost like she can't believe it.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: I've missed you so much, Wyll. The Grand Duke.
60.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, almost like she can't believe it.

356.speaker: Karlach
356.text: I've missed you so much, Wyll. The Blade of Frontiers.
356.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, almost like she can't believe it.

155.speaker: Karlach
155.text: I've missed you so much, Wyll. The Blade of Avernus.
155.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, almost like she can't believe it.

309.speaker: Karlach
309.text: I've missed you, Lae'zel. Really missed you.
309.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, almost like she can't believe it.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: I've missed you, Gale. Or should I say... your holiness?

234.speaker: Karlach
234.text: I've missed you, Gale. Gods, you look so... so fresh!

370.speaker: Karlach
370.text: I've missed you, you old Bhaalspawn. Oh - do you not want me to call you the B-word any more?

255.speaker: Karlach
255.text: I've missed you, man. Like, I've really missed you. And you're so... clean.
255.context: NodeContext: Wistfully, almost like she can't believe it.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: I have still gathered my Bhaalian horde: an army of scented candles and bath salts.

300.speaker: Karlach
300.text: Please tell me you're opening a bath house in the Gate. When I get out, I'm going to need to soak for years to wash off the stink of Avernus.

333.speaker: Karlach
333.text: It's been tough, keeping myself alive.

321.speaker: Player
321.text: It's all right, everyone slips up from time to time.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I see my blood not as a curse, but a duty. I have been studying Bhaal, so I can fight him, if his cult ever strikes again.

135.speaker: Karlach
135.text: You're too good, buddy. Well, you did save the world despite getting repeatedly possessed by the spirit of murder, so technically, you're the best.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: I'm just so glad you're doing all right. I've thought of you often, whenever I could spare half a thought. Surviving Avernus doesn't leave you much time to think.

305.speaker: Player
305.text: I don't think about my blood any more. I actually think I haven't killed a single person since we last met.

233.speaker: Player
233.text: Don't mind the projection. Only way to attend the party from Limbo.

236.speaker: Karlach
236.text: Limbo, huh. You and Lae'zel have really been going places. Gods, I wouldn't have the nerve to stand against the two of you, on any plane.

220.speaker: Karlach
220.text: As for the Avernus crew... man, that place is brutal.

363.speaker: Player
363.text: It's still me, Karlach. Just an... improved form.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Can't believe you really did it. Ascended. Wouldn't have picked that for you myself, but at least you look good.

157.speaker: Karlach
157.text: I don't even want to know what I look like. It's been hard in the Hells. As expected.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: Thank you for noticing, my friend. I've an excellent new beard oil.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: Mmm, you smell like a beautiful tree. I don't even want to know what I reek like. Fuel and imp guts, I'm sure.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Lady Shar has been good to me this past while, but I am glad to see you again.
36.context: NodeContext: A little bit teasing, a little bit genuinely afraid SH hasn't missed her since she's turned to Shar

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I took extra care to scrub up for tonight. You'd hardly even know I was milking a cow not too long ago.

189.speaker: Karlach
189.text: Milking a cow? Girl, you've got it made. I'd trade with you, if that weren't totally evil.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: Karlach. How can I begin to apologise for not being there at the end - when you needed me most.

267.speaker: Karlach
267.text: I looked for you. But I understood - can't have both of us burning up in one go.
267.context: NodeContext: Mix of heartbreak and understanding. Saying why she understands Astarion couldn't be with her during her death scene (she survived in the end).

313.speaker: Karlach
313.text: I've thought about you, though. How could I not? My sweet, wicked darling.

194.speaker: Karlach
194.text: Things in Avernus hasn't been easy. This isn't the life I would've picked for myself.
194.context: NodeContext: With gravity, but about to perk up, so not too dark.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: A little more myself than I'd like. I'm back to the shadows - back to hiding from Cazador.

228.speaker: Karlach
228.text: Somehow we're both back where we started, despite everything in between.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: You can't begin to imagine how wonderful.

360.speaker: Player
360.text: Enjoy my presence while you can. I won't be staying long.

180.speaker: Karlach
180.text: Me either. But I think my tin can can last a night before it's back to the Blood War.

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: Not that you asked, but guess what Wyll and I found in Avernus?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Forget the niceties. Always 'Wyll' to you, dear friend.

340.speaker: Player
340.text: We may as well call you the Axe of Avernus by now.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: Please, no! I don't want to draw any more attention from devils than I already have.

372.speaker: Player
372.text: You've never been far from my mind. Even when lopping off a royal kith'rak's head.

325.speaker: Karlach
325.text: War's a dirty business, isn't it, soldier. I'd say we're both good at surviving it, but you may have a bit more zest for the whole thing.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: You've never been far from my mind. You're braver than all of Vlaakith's forces combined.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: Good to know I didn't disappear completely when I left. I won't lie - it's been hard.

257.speaker: Karlach
257.text: But seeing you again reminds me what it's all for. Living - to keep living.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: My mucous membranes are self-cleaning. Thank you for noticing.

212.speaker: Karlach
212.text: You can't miss it! So... shiny.

373.speaker: Karlach
373.text: Haven't seen any mind flayers anywhere in Avernus, I must say. Never thought I'd miss 'em. War's a dirty business.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: How have things been in Avernus?

244.speaker: Karlach
244.text: Ah. War's a dirty business, soldier. It's been... exactly how you'd think.

174.speaker: Karlach
174.text: But having Wyll around has been incredible. Fucker's even better at killing devils than yours truly. We don't have much time to chat, but just knowing he's there makes all the difference.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: Oh, but hey! Guess what we found?

215.speaker: Karlach
215.text: Oh, but hey! Guess what I found?

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: I'd say so! Can't think of who's been carrying your pack now that K's out of commission.

299.speaker: Karlach
299.text: Man, we had some good times. Wish Wyll and I had more time to reminisce, but surviving Avernus is just non-stop.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: Still, having him there has been incredible. You really can get through anything with someone you love at your side.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Man, we had some good times. Wish I had more time to reminisce, but surviving Avernus is just non-stop.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: Oh, but hey! Guess what I found?

134.speaker: Karlach
134.text: Cambion dropped a map with directions and blueprints for Zariel's own, private forge. A fucking forge.

251.speaker: Karlach
251.text: My current plan is to get in, grab a smith, and force him to fix old rusty - or maybe give me a brand new model that can live outside Avernus.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: I shouldn't have let you go to Avernus without me. I should've gone with you.

163.speaker: Karlach
163.text: No - believe me, you shouldn't have. That place is fucking horrible. I wouldn't wish it on you - on anyone.

329.speaker: Karlach
329.text: But look, you showed me just how much my life is worth. That there are people out there who really value it.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: I can hang on in the Hells a while longer. Oh! Guess what we found?

375.speaker: Karlach
375.text: Cambion dropped a map with directions and blueprints for Zariel's own, private forge. A fucking forge.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: Our current plan is to get in, grab a smith, and force him to fix old rusty - or maybe give me a brand new model that can live outside Avernus.

326.speaker: Karlach
326.text: You haven't seen the last of ol' Karlach yet, soldier.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Kidnapping an Infernal smith sounds like fun. Mind if I tag along?

192.speaker: Karlach
192.text: I still love you way too much to let you follow me to that pit. But I can't say I'm not delighted you offered.

145.speaker: Karlach
145.text: Listen here: You keep your self well and able, and I'll come find you when I'm fixed.

383.speaker: Karlach
383.text: I can look you up when I'm out, can't I?

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Ao forbids the gods meddling in infernal matters, but if you pray to me, I'll do all I can to make your 'ambition' reality...

380.speaker: Karlach
380.text: Pray to you, huh? I'll, uh... I'll consider that.
380.context: NodeContext: She definitely won't be praying to Gale any time soon.

290.speaker: Karlach
290.text: I'd offer to look you up once I'm out, but something tells me you'll be hard to reach.

331.speaker: Karlach
331.text: I guess this is 'goodbye,' Gale Dekarios. Until we meet again, if we do.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: I'm so glad to hear you might be able to fix your heart. You must be so happy.

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: Trying not to count my owlbears before they've hatched, but the thought of coming back to Baldur's Gate keeps me going.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: If anyone can survive Avernus twice, it's you.

124.speaker: Karlach
124.text: Couldn't have said it better myself. Keep a bottle of something good in the ice box for me, huh? Mama K's coming home before too long.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I hope not. Good luck, Karlach.

200.speaker: Karlach
200.text: Hell, I don't need luck. I've got the Blade of Avernus on my side.

176.speaker: Karlach
176.text: Thanks soldier. I won't lie, I might need it.

314.speaker: Player
314.text: I think about you still, Karlach. I miss you. I miss what we had.

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: Who knows? Maybe we'll have it again some day. Maybe even sooner than you think.

179.speaker: Karlach
179.text: Can I look you up, when I'm out?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You won't find me, I'm afraid. I'll be far from Faerûn.

364.speaker: Player
364.text: You won't find me. I'll be far from Faerûn.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: If you've got a directory for Elysium, certainly.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You had better, or I'll hunt you down myself.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: With the stunt you pulled, I'd be delighted just to get noticed.
159.context: NodeContext: Friendly with that edge of hurt.

266.speaker: Karlach
266.text: It's good to see you again, soldier - it really is. Hard not to get used to it all over again.
266.context: NodeContext: Following a node where she was a bit mad at the player, so enthusiastic but more wistful

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: Hey, that would be kinda fun, no? High stakes hide and seek. Honestly I'd be curious to see if you could land a blow or two.

130.speaker: Karlach
130.text: Gods, is it good to see you again - to be here, together. Hard not to get used to it all over again.

204.speaker: Karlach
204.text: This won't be the last time. I promise.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: As long as a devil doesn't put too many holes in you in the meantime.

275.speaker: Karlach
275.text: Please. You know me. An absolute beast on the battlefield. I'll be fine - probably.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Let's say our goodbyes now. One never knows what the future holds.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Maybe you don't. But I'm not done with you yet.

349.speaker: Karlach
349.text: Goodbye for now, soldier. Until we meet again - whether you like it or not.

350.speaker: Karlach
350.context: NodeContext: in response to 'can i have a hug'

65.speaker: Karlach
65.text: I won't be in Avernus forever, you know. Can I look you up, when I'm out?

304.speaker: Player
304.text: I'd hoped Wyll and myself would've seen you in Avernus. Where have you been?!

260.speaker: Karlach
260.text: Avoiding you lot like the plague. Zariel's got her sights set on me. I don't want to drag you into my nonsense.

269.speaker: Karlach
269.text: Anyway, you lot are very good at killing devils without me.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I've been looking for you in Avernus. Where have you been?!

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: Avoiding you like the plague, Mr Ravengard. Zariel's got her sights set on me. I don't want to drag you into my nonsense.

237.speaker: Karlach
237.text: You're great at killing devils without me, anyway. Keep it up, and I'll sort myself out, too.

311.speaker: Karlach
311.text: Speaking of, guess what I found!

202.speaker: Karlach
202.text: Ah, soldier. How glad I am to see you again. I'd started to wonder if I ever would.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I've missed you, Karlach. When Vlaakith has fallen, I will return to you.

106.speaker: Karlach
106.text: You may not be so certain, when you realise just how much I've... evolved.

291.speaker: Karlach
291.text: My new life is strange, but happy. This form has changed me in ways I expected and those I didn't.

107.speaker: Karlach
107.text: Though I have missed you. And I wish we could have spoken in the intervening months. Your journey must have changed you significantly.

123.speaker: Karlach
123.text: I'm sorry I haven't reached out. I guess I wasn't sure what you'd make of me. I've changed so much. But then again, you have too.
123.context: NodeContext: responding to 'I'm sorry I haven't visited'

312.speaker: Player
312.text: You would've had a hard time finding me all the way in Limbo.

249.speaker: Karlach
249.text: True enough. Though in this form, nothing seems impossible. Your adventures with Lae'zel must be absolutely fascinating.

382.speaker: Player
382.text: Not so much changed as reverted. Back to skulking in the dark.

366.speaker: Player
366.text: Not so much changed as reverted. Back to skulking in the dark, though I do it better now.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: For the better, don't you find? I'm who I was meant to be - and it's wickedly fun.

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: The role of the Ascendent suits you - though I admit I was wrong about you. I thought you were becoming less malicious during our travels - not more.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: In a sense. I've become who I was destined to be - my Lady's right hand.

119.speaker: Karlach
119.text: There was a time I thought you'd seen another path for yourself. I thought perhaps the camaraderie we shared would sway you toward a gentler path.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: But I'm not as naive as I once was. In fact, I've become someone quite different altogether.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Yes. It's been strange, revelling in freedom and mourning my family at the same time. But I'm managing.

283.speaker: Karlach
283.text: Bittersweet, isn't it? You gave so much and lost so much, too.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: You can say that again - I know how to milk a cow now. Oh and my parents send their best.

301.speaker: Karlach
301.text: And mine to them. I'd love to meet them some time, if it wouldn't be too... distressing for them.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: Do you know, my favourite food used to be mutton chops. Want to know what it is now? Brains, soldier. Brains.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Despite the odds, yes. I'm still not entirely sure I deserve the fresh start, but I'm glad all the same.

323.speaker: Karlach
323.text: You deserve it more than anyone. You saved Baldur's Gate - all of Faerûn!

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Do you think? Honestly I feel much the same. Perhaps I missed an opportunity for self-improvement.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: There is time enough, if you still want - thanks to our efforts, of course.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: Our victory against the Dead Three changed everything.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I may be a Grand Duke. But I promise, I am still the same Wyll you always knew, old friend.

279.speaker: Karlach
279.text: But with a far more impressive wardrobe.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I may be a Grand Duke. But I promise, I am still the same Wyll you always knew, old friend.

347.speaker: Player
347.text: I hunt monsters, protect the coast, answer to Mizora. Am I really that different, old friend?

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: Perhaps not. You were always my hero - and still, the very sight of you inspires courage I sometimes lose sight of in this... cerebral new form.

328.speaker: Player
328.text: True enough. I still hunt monsters, protect the coast - but now, I do it on my terms.

132.speaker: Karlach
132.text: Ah, Wyll. To see you returned to the root of yourself, with your fate in your own hands... you're yourself, but more than ever.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: How right you are, old friend. I never pictured a life surrounded by devils, both friend and foe.

223.speaker: Karlach
223.text: You called me a devil once. I called you a fool. We were both so wrong. And together... together, we saved the world.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: True enough. I still hunt devils, protect the coast - but now, I do it on my terms.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: You are who you were meant to be. Your own man. And, as ever, as always - my hero.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: My blade is sharp as ever. But now, I wield it for a truly righteous cause.

208.speaker: Karlach
208.text: I remember when Vlaakith's favour was the lodestar of your life. But you weren't afraid to give her up as the facts demanded.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: Perhaps I should have been the one to reach out. But you are ghaik...

320.speaker: Karlach
320.text: I am. And would you believe that I'm happy?

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Not as much as you, I'd wager. Though I have taken up a spot of teaching...

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: I can think of no better man for the job of moulding minds. I'd love to see you in action, but I fear your students might find me fairly distressing.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: For one thing, I left Waterdeep behind. A Waterdhavian in spirit, but no longer in person.

368.speaker: Karlach
368.text: I never thought I'd see the day. But then again, our victory against the Dead Three changed everything.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: No part of me is unchanged. Every fibre of my being was made anew at the moment of my ascension.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: I can relate, in my own way.

286.speaker: Player
286.text: In some ways, I've gone full circle - Mystra's Chosen once more. But a wiser incarnation this time, I hope.

196.speaker: Karlach
196.text: I can feel it. You've evolved, same as myself.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I haven't really. I've just been looking after myself. Taking walks through nature. Doing breathing exercises.

137.speaker: Karlach
137.text: Impressive. You've been looking after yourself well - far different from the haunted person I once knew.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I have visited several historians of the Bhaalspawn crisis - I must ensure I am the last of my kind.

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: Your mind, once broken, has shown surprising resiliency.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: Not as much as you might think.

367.speaker: Karlach
367.text: Stubbornly yourself, aren't you. I suppose I used to be, too. But this evolution has shown me parts of myself I never knew existed.

354.speaker: Karlach
354.text: For example, my favourite food used to be mutton chops. Do you know what it is now? Brains, soldier. Brains.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Comes with the illithid territory, I suppose.

199.speaker: Karlach
199.text: True. But I've found ways to maintain my values while respecting that which I am - that which made it possible for me to live.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: I've made arrangements with a healer in the city. When a patient is beyond saving, but still able to speak for themselves, they're offered a choice.

310.speaker: Karlach
310.text: They can go as nature intends to take them. Or, when they're ready - when their goodbyes have been said, their affairs settled, and all that awaits them is pain - I relieve them.

153.speaker: Karlach
153.text: When I consume their brains, I am nourished by much more than the physical nutrition. Their memories - from birth to death - become part of me.

359.speaker: Karlach
359.text: I've lived hundreds of childhoods, first loves, marriages, feuds and friendships. I remember them all. And in this way, we all live on. Together.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I always loved that about you. Your compassion. Even in Elysium, I think of you always...

285.speaker: Karlach
285.text: I think of you, too. This life of ours, soldier - it's a long one, if we're lucky. Who knows what the future holds for either of us.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Ah, Karlach. You haven't changed, not really. I still think of you, you know.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Thanks, soldier. It feels that way, too.

243.speaker: Karlach
243.text: It's been wonderful to see you again. Reminds me of old times around the campfire. We used to think becoming a mind flayer was a fate worse than death.

327.speaker: Karlach
327.text: I wouldn't trade my life - this life - for anything. Funny how things change, isn't it?

362.speaker: Player
362.text: I never expected this to be your life, Karlach. But I'm happy for you.

229.speaker: Karlach
229.text: Thanks, soldier. It's good to see you looking so well. And now that we've connected again, don't be a stranger.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Enjoy the night, my friend. I know I will.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Something about it doesn't sit right with me.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Curious. To hear you describe the life of an illithid, it almost sounds like a form of godhood...

152.speaker: Karlach
152.text: It's strange, I know. I couldn't have imagined this life for myself in a million years. But... I think I'm doing good in the world - and staying fed along the way. What more could a Karlach want?

270.speaker: Player
270.text: Those can't be easy to come by. How do you get them?

263.speaker: Karlach
263.text: I thought I was good at cracking skulls before. Now, I've got it down to something of a science - or maybe more of a religion.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: The old Karlach would be aghast to hear that.

374.speaker: Karlach
374.text: Maybe at first. But the person I used to be had a deep empathy that hasn't left me. Let me explain.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: Defeating the Dead Three will do that to you.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Don't I know it. It went so fast, didn't it? One moment we were on the nautiloid, the next we were... here.

150.speaker: Karlach
150.text: I'd ask you what you'd been up to for six whole months, but then I'd have to reciprocate. And I'm not sure you're ready for the truth.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: After all we've been through together, you don't have to hide anything from me.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: You haven't been haunting the sewers eating peoples' brains, have you?

103.speaker: Karlach
103.text: I'm not a murderer, if that's what you mean. But a girl's got to eat.

316.speaker: Karlach
316.text: Do you remember how my favourite food used to be mutton chops? I'm now far more interested in... well, brains.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Maybe we shouldn't discuss it, then.

246.speaker: Karlach
246.text: As you like, soldier. It's very good to see you looking so well, regardless.

358.speaker: Player
358.text: Observe the sheen of mucous on her skin; the tentacles where her mouth once was. Can this really be Karlach?

262.speaker: Karlach
262.text: I can't tell if that's admiration or revulsion on your face. Or maybe something else entirely.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: I was waiting for an invitation.

210.speaker: Karlach
210.text: Maybe I thought our paths would cross on their own. Or maybe I wasn't sure what you'd make of me. I've changed so much. But then again, you have too.

242.speaker: Karlach
242.text: Honestly? Never better. My life is so rich now - so... multifaceted. I've wanted to share it with you, but maybe I was scared. I've changed so much. But then again, so have you.

343.speaker: Karlach
343.text: It's good to be among friends again, isn't it?

365.speaker: Karlach
365.text: It's so good to be back, isn't it? Ahh, it smells like... mm, like home.
